title: 'We'll hit them ...': Trump on Iran's threat to target US bases; over 500 killed in protests
content: US President Donald Trump stated Washington is monitoring Iran's deadly protests and considering military retaliation, warning of unprecedented strikes if attacked. Iran's President accused the US and Israel of fomenting unrest, while the UN urged an end to the violent crackdown and restoration of internet access. Activists report over 544 deaths and thousands detained amid escalating violence.

title: The Delta Force gap: Why China can't do a Maduro-type op — for now
content: US precision in Venezuela operation sparks debate on China's capabilities. Analysts highlight US advantage in integrated, all-domain operations, a fusion China lacks due to fragmented special forces and political control. While China boasts modern weaponry, replicating swift, surgical strikes against Taiwan remains a distant prospect, suggesting any attempt would be far more destructive.

title: T20 World Cup row: B'desh matches to stay in India; security risk 'low', says ICC source
content: The ICC has dismissed claims by Bangladesh’s sports adviser that security concerns could bar Bangladesh from travelling to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup, stating its independent risk assessments rate the threat level as low to moderate and fully manageable

title: Gurgaon: Coach 'rapes' minor at stadium bathroom; pregnancy led to complaint
content: A junior hockey coach in Gurgaon has been arrested. He is accused of raping a minor student four months ago. The student, a Class 12 player, reported the incident after becoming pregnant. She suffered a miscarriage. The coach is in police custody for questioning. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Apple's Korea hotel gambit failing: Memory costs jump 300%; chipmakers refuse long-term deals
content: Apple executives are in South Korea negotiating memory chip deals amidst soaring prices, up to 300% since mid-2025.  Memory makers are planning aggressive hikes, even charging Samsung's own divisions significantly more.  This AI-driven shortage means less RAM for phones and PCs, with Apple facing tough renegotiations this month.

title: WPL 2026: Grace Harris blitz powers RCB to nine-wicket win over UP Warriorz
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru achieved a commanding nine-wicket win against UP Warriorz. An explosive opening partnership between Grace Harris and Smriti Mandhana powered RCB's chase. UP Warriorz posted 143 for 5, with Deepti Sharma and Deandra Dottin building a crucial partnership. RCB chased down the target swiftly, with Harris scoring a rapid fifty. This marks RCB's second consecutive win.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper fares out! Which route will it run on? Check price & features
content: Vande Bharat sleeper launch: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train this month, with services beginning on the Howrah–Guwahati route and fares starting at around Rs 2,300.

title: Netflix deal: Paramount sues Warner Bros; seeks disclosure on $82.7 billion deal
content: Paramount Skydance is escalating its battle for Warner Bros. Discovery by suing for greater disclosure on the proposed Netflix deal. The company also plans to nominate directors and launch a proxy contest, arguing its all-cash offer is superior and seeking shareholder approval for any cable asset separation.

title: 'You can't align what you can't control': Microsoft AI boss warns rivals
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: 'Shared dreams': 2 years after divorce - Shikhar Dhawan announces engagement to Sophie Shine
content: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan announced his engagement to long-time partner Sophie Shine, an Irish product consultant, via a joint Instagram post. The couple, who met in Dubai, shared their joy with fans, marking a new chapter after Dhawan's retirement from cricket and recent divorce. While wedding date speculation exists, no official announcement has been made.

title: 'ICC's existence is unnecessary': Ex-Pakistan cricketer's explosive attack on BCCI dominance
content: Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal has voiced strong criticism of the ICC, suggesting it's losing relevance due to perceived Indian board dominance. He questioned the council's impartiality, citing India's refusal to play in Pakistan as evidence of the ICC's lack of control. Ajmal believes many nations privately agree but fear speaking out.

title: Jeff Bezos on why all the companies building datacentres are 'wrong': It is much better to just...
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos criticizes the current trend of companies building private AI data centers, likening it to early 20th-century factories generating their own power. He argues this approach is inefficient and predicts a shift towards centralized cloud services like AWS.

title: Project-75I: How India’s Rs 72,000 cr submarine upgrade reshapes the Pakistan, China equation
content: India's Project-75I, acquiring six advanced German Type-214NG submarines, is gaining urgency amid regional tensions and China's growing undersea presence. This crucial naval procurement emphasises indigenous construction, technology transfer, and bolstering India's deterrence capabilities in the Indian Ocean.

title: 'Won't go to any version of me that didn't know you': Anushka's post goes viral
content: As Vamika turned three on January 11, Anushka shared a post on Instagram and wrote a note about motherhood and how it has changed her life. She said she would not want to return to a time before becoming a parent.

title: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant’s combined net worth after Kobe Bryant
content: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant, following the tragic loss of Kobe Bryant, have amassed a combined net worth of $606 million. Vanessa manages the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation and benefits from brand deals and business ventures. Natalia, a budding model, contributes to her $6 million net worth through her career and inheritance.

title: Erin Andrews’ viral NFL playoff coat sparks mixed fan reactions
content: Erin Andrews went viral during the NFL playoffs after her bold sideline coat drew comparisons to Cruella de Vil. The Fox Sports reporter sparked debate, jokes, and praise while delivering key injury updates during the Eagles vs 49ers Wild Card game, proving style and substance collided under playoff pressure as cameras rolled and social media erupted nationwide instantly that night.

title: NFL Playoff Schedule 2026: Bills-Broncos, 49ers-Seahawks set as times await
content: The NFL football playoff schedule 2026 is taking shape after Wild Card Weekend. Divisional round matchups are set, but kickoff times and TV assignments remain undecided. Seattle, Denver, Chicago, and New England will host, while one AFC spot hinges on Monday night. Here’s the full schedule, dates, and what still needs to be finalized.

title: Bills’ Darius Slay spotted at Eagles vs 49ers game, fans confused
content: Veteran cornerback Darius Slay, technically on the Buffalo Bills roster, sparked widespread confusion by attending the Philadelphia Eagles’ playoff game against the San Francisco 49ers. After a stint with the Steelers and being claimed by the Bills, Slay reportedly considered retirement during 2025 season. His presence in Philadelphia has fueled widespread speculation about his future and lingering ties to his former team, where he won a Super Bowl.

title: Kattuppadu trumps Koottani? NDA under stress in Tamil Nadu; EPS draws red line
content: For Tamil Nadu’s political culture, shaped by decades of Dravidian assertion and a strong emphasis on regional autonomy, such an explicit pre-election claim has few precedents. The reaction within the AIADMK has been wary, if not outright resistant, as the BJP’s clout in the South remains lean. The pre-poll power-sharing deal, however, is only one strand in a much larger and more byzantine political development.

title: 'Like Dhoni': Ex-India cricketer lauds finisher Rahul's single taking ability
content: KL Rahul showcased remarkable composure and adaptability in India's tense four-wicket victory over New Zealand. He expertly navigated a challenging chase, prioritizing strike rotation and protecting his partners before unleashing his finishing skills in the final overs. Chopra lauded Rahul's maturity and game awareness, comparing his calm demeanor to MS Dhoni's.

title: Hema Malini breaks silence on Dharamendra, Sunny and Bobby Deol
content: Hema Malini reflects on life after Dharmendra's death six weeks ago, cherishing their 57-year bond. In a candid interview, she shares grief, his final days, and cordial ties with step-sons Sunny and Bobby Deol despite rumors. "I miss him every minute," she says, praising his fulfilling life.

title: How Rubio's childhood shaped Trump's Venezuela policy
content: Marco Rubio grew up inside that world. His political formation was not shaped by textbooks or diplomatic theory but by stories of a lost homeland, a stolen future and a US that, in exile memory, had failed to finish the job in 1961. Cuba was not history. It was a wound.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: 'No nation more essential...': Gor says next call on India-US deal tomorrow; tariffs in focus
content: India-US trade deal: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor said trade deal talks are ongoing, with both sides actively engaged and the next discussion scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Stroke kills 5M globally each year: Neurologist shares life-saving signs
content: Every 40 seconds, a stroke strikes, altering lives instantly.  Recognizing B.E.F.A.S.T. warning signs – Balance, Eyes, Face, Arm, Speech, and Time – is crucial.  High blood pressure, atherosclerosis, and lifestyle choices are key causes.  Prompt medical attention, clot-busting drugs, or clot removal can save lives and prevent lasting damage. Prevention through healthy habits is paramount.

title: Happy Lohri 2026: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Lohri, North India's vibrant harvest festival, celebrates the end of winter and the sun's return to longer days. Primarily observed by Punjabis, Sikhs, and Hindus, it's a thanksgiving for rabi crops, marked by bonfires, traditional songs, and festive foods. In 2026, Lohri falls on January 13th, ushering in a period of joy and new beginnings.

title: 'Seize and hold the cities': 5 takeaways from Reza Pahlavi's declaration amid Iran protests
content: Pahlavi does not present himself merely as a supporter of the street movement. He explicitly says that the scale of the demonstrations has given him the authority to act. “With the legitimacy and acceptance I have received from you,” he says, “I declare another phase of the national uprising to overthrow the Islamic Republic and reclaim our beloved Iran.”

title: Dhankhar hospitalised: Ex-VP admitted to AIIMS, to undergo MRI; fainted twice last week
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was admitted to AIIMS on Monday. He experienced two episodes of unconsciousness last week. Doctors at AIIMS insisted on his admission for further tests. Dhankhar had previously fainted on several occasions while serving as Vice President. He resigned from his post in July citing health reasons.

title: Big Bash: Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan gets retired out after slow knock - watch
content: Mohammad Rizwan became the first overseas player in the BBL to be retired out after struggling to accelerate the scoring for Melbourne Renegades.  He managed 26 runs off 23 balls, and his departure did little to boost the team's momentum, as they finished on 170/8. Rizwan's BBL campaign has been below expectations with 167 runs in eight matches.

title: From Maharashtra to TN, has 'women first' become best poll bet for parties?
content: Political parties are increasingly targeting women voters, seen as kingmakers in elections. Ahead of Maharashtra's civic polls, the state government scheduled welfare payouts just before voting, drawing criticism from the Congress. Similarly, Tamil Nadu's DMK government expanded its women's welfare scheme and announced additional payments, also facing accusations of electoral timing.

title: 'Is Virat Kohli arrogant?' Ajinkya Rahane gives a candid answer – watch
content: Ajinkya Rahane offers a unique insight into Virat Kohli's mindset, revealing his greatness stems from a misunderstood 'attitude of learning and never giving up.' Rahane explains Kohli's pre-match withdrawal isn't arrogance but a method to enter his zone. Kohli's relentless work ethic and drive for improvement continue to define his record-breaking career.

title: 'Will come to Mumbai, try cutting my legs': Annamalai fires back at Raj Thackeray; slams ‘rasmalai’ jab
content: BJP leader K Annamalai dared MNS chief Raj Thackeray to stop him from entering Mumbai after receiving threats, including those of physical harm. Thackeray had earlier mocked Annamalai and questioned his connection to Mumbai, while also vowing to expel Bihari and UP migrants imposing Hindi.

title: Luke Littler net worth: Tournament winnings, endorsements, and earnings
content: Teenage darts sensation Luke Littler has rapidly risen on the PDC circuit, winning major titles and earning over £2 million in prize money. Backed by lucrative sponsorships, media work, and global brand deals, Littler has become one of the most marketable and financially successful young stars in professional darts.

title: '40 balls daily daalne hain, batting ke baad': How Ayush Badoni earned maiden India call-up
content: Ayush Badoni received a maiden India call-up for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand, replacing an injured Washington Sundar. His coach highlighted Badoni's dedication to improving his off-spin bowling, a skill he developed through rigorous practice. Badoni's all-round abilities and leadership experience also contributed to his selection.

title: Shikhar Dhawan announces engagement to Sophie: Are they getting married in February 2026?
content: Shikhar Dhawan announced his engagement to Irish girlfriend Sophie Shine on January 12th, sharing a picture with his ladylove. The couple, who confirmed their relationship in May 2025, met in Dubai and have been living together for over a year. They are reportedly set to marry in February 2026.

title: 'Have to maintain decorum': Om Birla slams Kirti Azad for vaping inside Parliament; adds 'action soon'
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced disciplinary action against TMC MP Kirti Azad for allegedly vaping in the House. Birla emphasized maintaining parliamentary decorum, stating that violations will be punished under established rules.

title: What now for five losing teams from wild-card weekend? Barnwell on each front office's next steps
content: Potential offensive changes for the Eagles? Retooling needed for the Packers? Let's size up why five playoff teams are heading home early.

title: Sources: Packers will try to keep LaFleur as HC
content: The Packers are expected to try to work out a deal in the coming days to keep head coach Matt LaFleur in Green Bay, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Raiola joins Oregon as Ducks await Moore's call
content: Former Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola announced Monday on social media that he has committed to sign with Oregon.

title: Alonso out as Real Madrid boss after Barca loss
content: Real Madrid on Monday announced that Xabi Alonso would no longer coach the club "by mutual agreement."

title: Sources: LSU likely adding QB Leavitt from portal
content: LSU is expected to sign Arizona State transfer Sam Leavitt, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday, giving coach Lane Kiffin his likely QB1 in his first year with the Tigers.

title: Sox foiled after 'falling short' in Bregman pursuit
content: The Red Sox said it was "disappointing to lose out" on Alex Bregman after reportedly not offering a no-trade clause to the free agent, who is joining the Cubs.

title: Rams' Stafford has finger sprain but 'good to go'
content: Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford sprained the index finger on his throwing hand but will be "good to go" this Sunday against the Bears.

title: Sirianni defends Brown after drops, sideline spat
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni defended wide receiver A.J. Brown after a pair of drops in Sunday's loss to the Niners and also downplayed an animated interaction the two had in the opening half.

title: LeBron gets jersey patch honoring 23rd season
content: To mark his record 23rd season, LeBron James will wear a jersey patch featuring a silhouette of his pregame chalk toss and the colors of the teams he has played for.

title: Steelers aren't sweating playoff drought: 'We came here for what lies ahead'
content: As Pittsburgh aims to end playoff futility, how's the team approaching Monday's game (8:15 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN)?

title: Texas-sized turnaround has Houston rolling into playoffs
content: Two key wins and a sideline scuffle highlight a run to the playoffs that happened despite an 0-3 start.

title: Has your team gotten stronger or weaker? Our midwinter progress report for all 30 MLB clubs
content: With a lot of work still left to do, here's how the 2026 win projections and playoff odds stand today.

title: Four first-round picks for a star?! It's risky. Lessons from the past 14 blockbuster trades
content: As teams shy away from dealing first-rounders for stars, which trades have been the biggest successes and utter failures?

title: Party like '99? Three reasons for -- and three against -- New York winning the East
content: Nearly halfway through the season, do the Knicks look any closer to reaching the Finals for the first time in 26 years?

title: What comes next after a wild week in the hockey world?
content: From trade chatter in multiple cities to epic blowouts to a hole in the Olympic ice, hockey fans have lots to digest.

title: How Barcelona won Supercopa; Man United exit FA Cup; Frank in trouble at Spurs; more
content: Raphinha and Barcelona stunned rivals Real Madrid to win the Supercopa de España, Man United's coaching quest continues as they exit the FA Cup, and time's running out for Spurs boss Thomas Frank. as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: From Wrexham to Macclesfield, FA Cup reminded us why we love soccer
content: Thanks to Macclesfield causing one of the biggest upsets ever and Wrexham passing their Premier League test, the FA Cup third round really delivered.

title: Supreme Court transgender athlete cases FAQ: What to expect
content: The national debate over transgender athlete participation will be heard by the U.S. Supreme Court. Here's what you need to know.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: 'Hungry for more': 49ers' petty posts at Eagles tops NFL wild-card trolls
content: The NFL wild-card round had its fair share of petty posts after big wins, led by the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Hindu Auto Driver, 28, Beaten To Death In Bangladesh
content: A Hindu autor driver, Samir Das, was beaten to death in Bangladesh, the latest in the series of attacks on Hindu minorities in the country, say local media reports.

title: India's Gen Z Is Full Of Creativity, Says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said India's Gen Z is full of creativity and with innovative ideas, energy and purpose, the country's youth is at the forefront of nation-building.

title: Citizenship For Rs 30,000? NDTV Report On Illegal Immigration In Mumbai
content: India's border states, such as Assam, Tripura, and West Bengal, frequently make headlines regarding illegal infiltration, a major political flashpoint.

title: "Not A 'Milap', But A 'Vilap'": Eknath Shinde Slams Thackeray Brothers' Reunion
content: Shiv Sena supremo and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday asserted that no one can split Mumbai from Maharashtra.

title: "Know Pain Of Losing Home": New UN Refugee Agency Chief Was Once In Exile
content: Barham Salih has known torture and the wrenching loss of exile. Four decades after his own ordeal, he has taken the helm of the UN refugee agency as it grapples with a funding shortfall and ever-rising needs.

title: Iran Foreign Ministry Says Communication Channel 'Open' With US Envoy
content: A channel of communication is open between Iran and US President Donald Trump's special envoy for the Middle East despite the lack of diplomatic relations, the Iranian foreign ministry spokesman said Monday.

title: Two Houses, Two Irans: Inside Homes Of A Prince And His Nemesis
content: NDTV went to the houses of both Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, and the religious leader who overthrew him, Ruhollah Khomeini, in Iran's capital Tehran.

title: Delhi's Minimum Temperature Drops To 3.2 Degrees Celsius Amid Cold Wave
content: A bitter chill hung over the national capital with temperatures dropping further, even as the IMD on Monday forecast similar conditions for the next day.

title: Telangana Employees To Face 10% Salary Cut For Not Taking Care Of Parents
content: The Telangana government will enact a law to deduct 10 per cent salary of the government employees who are not looking after their parents and transfer the same to the bank accounts of the parents.

title: Indore Contaminated Water Deaths Rise To 23, Residents Live With Fear
content: The human cost of Indore's contaminated water crisis continues to climb. On Monday, the number of dead rose to 23 with the death of Bhagwandas Bharne, 64, son of Tukaram Bharne, who had been undergoing treatment for nearly 10 days, officials said.

title: Obscenity At Chhattisgarh Dance Programme, One More Cop Suspended
content: The crackdown in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband district has widened in the wake of viral videos showing alleged obscene acts at a dance programme where officials and policemen were seen showering dancers with cash.

title: Woman With 4 Children Allowed To Contest Nagpur Civic Polls. Law Says She Can't
content: Pushpa Waghmare, a mother of four, is contesting the Nagpur Municipal Corporation elections despite a law stating that candidates with more than two children cannot contest civic elections in Maharashtra.

title: Gold Hits Lifetime High, Silver Soars 6% To Record Rs 2.65 Lakh Per kg
content: Silver prices rallied sharply by Rs 15,000 to hit a lifetime high of Rs 2,65,000 per kg in the national capital on Monday, and gold advanced to a fresh record of Rs 1,44,600 per 10 grams, mirroring strong gains in the global markets.

title: "Not To Be Messed With": Venezuelan Security Guard Who Survived US Op
content: A Venezuelan security guard, who was on duty during the US operation to capture the country's leader Nicolas Maduro, has revealed what transpired during Operation Absolute Resolve on January 3.

title: Displaced People Protest In Manipur's Imphal To Return Home, Question 'Buffer Zone'
content: Hundreds of internally displaced persons (IDPs) held a massive rally in Manipur's capital Imphal today demanding security for returning home to their abandoned villages in the foothills.

title: Child Among 3 Killed, 6 Nepalese Nationals Feared Trapped In Himachal Fire
content: Three people, including an eight-year-old child, died in a major fire that broke out in the Old Bus Stand area of the Arki market in the Solan district, police said on Monday.

title: TVK Not Responsible, Vijay Told CBI In Questioning Over Karur Stampede: Sources
content: After nearly six hours of questioning by the Central Bureau of Investigation in Delhi, TVK chief Vijay on Monday told the premier agency that his party is not responsible for the stampede in Tamil Nadu that claimed 41 lives, sources have told NDTV.

title: "No Conversations With US": Cuban President Refutes Trump's Claim Of Talks
content: Cuba's leader said Monday there were "no conversations" with the United States, after President Donald Trump urged the communist-ruled island to "make a deal" or pay the price.

title: "Foreign Interference Intensifying Unrest": Iran's India Envoy To NDTV
content: Iran's Ambassador to India Mohammad Fathali said protests initially had a peaceful character, but gradually they were steered toward violence and insecurity by foreign elements.

title: Top Court Asks Abu Salem To Justify Claim Of Having Spent 25 Years In Jail
content: The Supreme Court asked gangster Abu Salem to justify his claim that he has spent 25 years in jail, a contention if proven will allow him to walk free from jail.

title: Chinese Communist Party delegation to meet RSS leaders in Delhi
content: A top RSS member says the meeting taking place in RSS’s centenary year is an attempt to bring in confidence building measures between the two countries

title: Ex-refugee takes over as UNHCR chief
content: A former Iraqi president, Barham Salih, 65, became the first former head of state to run the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR) at the start of the year

title: Supreme Court names new trial judge for coal scam cases
content: Incumbent Special CBI Judge Sanjay Bansal was to officiate from April 8, 2025, onwards for a period of six months only

title: Russia claims Oreshnik missile hit Ukrainian aviation plant
content: Moscow said it fired the Oreshnik in response to its allegations that Ukraine attempted to hit one of President Vladimir Putin’s residences in a drone strike

title: Police conduct raids, destroy arenas to prevent rooster fights
content: Drones are being used to check illegal activities in remote villages and stern action will be taken against those who violate the orders, say police

title: India, Germany to simplify defence trade: PM Modi
content: India will launch a ‘consultation mechanism’ on increasing collaboration with Germany in the Indo-Pacific region, says Prime Minister Modi

title: Non-application of mind, ‘copy-paste’ order led to detention under NSA: Wangchuk in Supreme Court
content: Application of mind by the detaining authority should be independent of the material provided to it by the authorities proposing it, the climate activist’s counsel Kapil Sibal argues in the court

title: New South Wales University to open Bengaluru campus in August, at Manyata Tech Park
content: The University of New South Wales, one of Australia’s leading universities, will open its campus in Bengaluru at Manyata Tech Park in August, 2026

title: No receipts for SIR documents, Mamata writes fifth letter to CEC
content: In the letter, the Chief Minister also pointed out that many genuine voters are being categorised as “logical discrepancies” and called for hearings

title: Centre steps in as two Nipah cases detected in Bengal
content: Both patients are healthcare workers; West Bengal government asks people to not panic but stay alert and take precautions

title: Government disputes reports that it plans to ask phone makers to disclose source code
content: The reports, based on a 2023 cybersecurity standard put out by a body under the Department of Technology, were mischaracterising the government’s conversations with phone makers, says the IT Ministry

title: ‘Chaos may happen’ if Kuki-Zo MLAs join Manipur govt., says KZC chairman
content: Henlianthang Thanglet, chief of the conglomerate of Kuki-Zo bodies, said in an interview with The Hindu that it was the ten Kuki-Zo MLAs who first wrote to the Prime Minister for a separate administration; of the 10 MLAS, 7 belong to the BJP

title: Victim safety, sanctity of trial paramount to consider bail in POCSO cases: Supreme Court
content: The Bench held that the April 2025 order of the Allahabad High Court granting bail had resulted in a ‘miscarriage of justice’, as it failed to account for the threat to the victim’s safety

title: Reopening of Kamaraj Road brings relief, but commuters fear fresh traffic chaos on M.G. Road
content: Kamaraj Road was fully reopened on January 2, 2026, restoring the two-way traffic between Cubbon Road and MG Road.

title: PM Modi, German Chancellor Merz inaugurate International Kite Festival 2026 in Ahmedabad
content: PM and German Chancellor get grand welcome with music and dance performances; the leaders visit exhibit reflecting Ahmedabad’s architectural heritage, observe kite-making demonstrations

title: SAAP launches State Sports Calendar in Tirupati
content: Ravi Naidu says the calendar will provide advance clarity on competitions and training programmes, enabling sportspersons to plan systematically and boosting sports development across Andhra Pradesh

title: Notice to State government on PIL seeking 30 acre land for constructing new building for Karnataka High Court
content: The petitioner points out to the court that recently Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has given a statement to the media that the government is identifying land for constructing a new building for the High Court

title: VTU to launch app to track activity points for students to prevent fraud
content: All students will have to download this app and upload geo-tagged photos of their extra curricular activities, which will earn them activity points

title: Paddy procurement to begin soon
content: Rice mills to collect paddy procured by Supplyco in all districts, except Palakkad, where paddy will be procured through cooperative societies

title: HIV infections among Kerala youth increasing at an alarming rate, says Veena George
content: New cases of HIV among those in the 15-24 year age group, which was 9% in 2022, had risen to 14.2% in 2024. This figure was 15.4% between April and October in 2025

title: Public sector banks appeal against stay on fraud classification proceedings against Anil Ambani
content: The banks challenged a single Bench order passed in December 2025 granting interim relief to Ambani and his company

title: Senior police officer inspects Government Boys Home during Operation Smile XII
content: Assesses overall living conditions and safety measures at the home, and examines the systems in place for the care, protection and rehabilitation of the children

title: Toll collection on Vengalam-Ramanattukara stretch of NH likely to begin soon at Pantheerankavu
content: Six-laning works on the Vengalam-Ramanattukara stretch of the Kozhikode bypass were completed last year covering about 28 kilometres

title: Notice issued to Rahul Easwar
content: The police had sought cancellation of his bail, stating that he had violated bail conditions by insulting the survivor in sexual assault case yet again

title: People’s struggles do not fail: Sarah Joseph
content: Golden jubilee of socio-political life of Lalur movement leader and former Naxalite T.K. Vasu observed

title: Celebration of student creativity from Jan. 14
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate five-day State School Arts Festival.  Reflecting Thrissur’s famed Pooram grandeur, the opening ceremony will feature traditional Pandi Melam and a vibrant Kudamattam with 64 children symbolically representing the 64th edition of the Kalolsavam

title: Target set to give four lakh govt. jobs to youth in Rajasthan, says CM
content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma says the State government had taken strict action against paper leaks in the recruitment examinations, pointing out that no such incident had occurred in the last two years

title: Demand for separate Secunderabad Municipal Corporation ‘lacks merit and logic’: officials
content: Secunderabad does not function as a self-sustaining economic unit, and carving out a civic body would result in higher per-capita service delivery costs, officials told the Chief Minister

title: Sabarimala comes under thick security blanket
content: Pilgrims have been asked to view the Makara Jyothi only from designated viewpoints at Pandithavalam, Saramkuthi and the U-turn area and avoid gathering at unsafe hilltop locations

title: School arts festival gold cup gets rousing welcome in Thrissur
content: Trophy procession draws massive public participation.  Public representatives, students, teaching and non-teaching staff, officials of the Education department, PTA members, and local residents joined the march, turning it into a vibrant celebration

title: Kerala actor rape case: court slams survivor’s counsel for her conduct during trial, lawyer terms it unfortunate
content: Court makes the remarks while considering a contempt of court petition filed by the survivor in the case against former Director General of Police R. Sreelekha

title: Vizhinjam ward election held
content: The ward witnessed 66.97% polling, with 8,912 out of the 13,307 voters casting their votes. If BJP wins, it will secure the simple majority figure of 51 in the 101-ward Corporation. The election also holds strategic importance for the LDF and the UDF, both of which aim to bolster their representation in standing committees.

title: Rubber farmers to be provided assistance for replacing low-yield trees under KERA Project
content: Farmers in six districts will receive financial assistance of ₹75,000 per hectare for the replanting scheme under the project

title: Mudigere MLA reacts to online comments
content: The Chikkamagaluru police arrested a person who made objectionable comments in September 2025; they have also filed a chargesheet in the case.

title: RJD MP faces backlash over alleged remarks against Yadav voters
content: In a viral video, RJD MP Surendra Yadav is seen abusing members from the Yadav community, saying they did not vote for the party in the recently concluded assembly elections.

title: Environmentalists, seers, legislators oppose river linking project in Sirsi
content: Environmentalists said diverting water from Uttara Kannada to other districts could damage the forests here and also reduce rainfall, defeating the very purpose of diverting surplus water to drier districts of north Karnataka

title: SC asks gangster Abu Salem to justify claim of having spent 25 years in jail
content: According to the extradition terms agreed upon by India and Portugal, Salem cannot be given death penalty and his prison term cannot exceed 25 years

content: The Union Minister describes the new rural job scheme as an effective and pro-people Act, while terming the opposition to it as wrong

title: Semifinal takeaways: Utter dominance has become the norm for Indiana
content: Texas, Penn State and Clemson were among the preseason national title favorites . the hoosiers and Hurricanes will play in the CFP national championship on Jan. 19 in the Hard Rock Stadium . they will play for their first title since 2001 .

title: The 10 teams that have gotten off to the hottest portal starts
content: college football's offseason transfer window opened one week ago . a dozen FBS programs have secured commitments from 20 or more players in the portal . there are 10 programs off to impressive starts in building up their rosters for 2026 .

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: NLL Week 7 recap: Knighthawks defeat Bandits in western New York clash
content: all games this season can be seen on the new ESPN App and in the NLL streaming hub . the Rochester Knighthawks won both contests to move into second place behind the Saskatchewan Rush . click here for the updated standings after week 7 .

title: Jones won't fight, McGregor will and more 2026 MMA predictions
content: MMA is arguably the most unpredictable sport, because scheduling is based on wins and losses, so no prognostication is too far out . the widespread expectation going into 2026 is that Jones will absolutely make his return to MMA . he will end his short retirement in hopes of fighting at the white house this summer .

title: With no manager, Man United sink to new lows
content: manchester united have seen some low ebbs in the 13 years since Ferguson retired . the 2025-26 campaign will take its place after Brighton ensured any chance of silverware has been extinguished by early January . 12 candidates to replace Ruben Amorim - the inside story of why man united sacked Ruben amorim.

title: What's next for LaFleur, Brian Gutekunst after the Packers' wild-card loss?
content: the last time the Packers did anything with the contracts of coach Matt LaFleur and general manager Brian Gutekunst, it happened in relative secrecy . the news did not leak out until just before training camp in July that year . it was never clear why then-team president Mark Murphy tried to keep it a secret .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the rankings are out for the second time since the calendar turned to 2026 . a slew of upsets over the past week left just three undefeated teams .

title: Josh Allen, Bills outlast Jaguars to advance to AFC divisional round
content: the defense did its job to preserve a 27-24 loss to the Bills . quarterback Josh Allen tipped a Trevor Lawrence pass and safety Cole Bishop came away with the game-ending interception . the ball was in the hands of the team, just as the team would like .

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: Niners defeat defending champs for NFC wild-card win
content: the 49ers won 12 games despite playing most of the season without defensive end and linebacker . they had withstood the repeated injuries to some of their brightest stars . despite that devastating injury to another team leader and captain, they continued to battle .

title: 'I do smile, and I am happy, at times': The 2025 college football season in quotes
